canonical_explanation.text: Directions help us find places and move around. There are four main directions: North, South, East, and West. The sun rises in the East and sets in the West. If you face North, South is behind you, East is to your right, and West is to your left. A map is a drawing that shows places from above, like a bird looking down from the sky. Maps use symbols to show things like roads, buildings, rivers, and parks. Landmarks are well-known places like schools, hospitals, temples, and post offices that help us find our way. When we read a map, we can find where things are and how to get from one place to another.
rules: The four main directions are North, South, East, and West
The sun rises in the East and sets in the West
A map shows places from above, like a bird's eye view
Maps use symbols to show roads, buildings, rivers, and other places
Landmarks are well-known places that help us find our way

questions.question_text: How many main directions are there?
questions.explanation_correct: There are four main directions: North, South, East, and West. These help us know which way to go and find places.
questions.explanation_incorrect: There are not two, three, or six main directions. The four main directions are North, South, East, and West. You can remember them easily by going clockwise: North, East, South, West.

questions.question_text: In which direction does the sun rise?
questions.explanation_correct: The sun rises in the East every morning. That is why the direction where the sun comes up is called East. The sun then sets in the West in the evening.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun does not rise in the North, South, or West. It always rises in the East. Remember: the sun rises in the East and sets in the West.

questions.question_text: In which direction does the sun set?
questions.explanation_correct: The sun sets in the West every evening. After rising in the East in the morning, the sun moves across the sky and sets in the West.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun does not set in the East, North, or South. It always sets in the West. Remember: East is where the sun rises, and West is where the sun sets.

questions.question_text: If you face North, which direction is behind you?
questions.explanation_correct: If you face North, South is behind you. North and South are opposite directions, just like East and West are opposite directions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When you face North, the direction behind you is always South because North and South are opposite. East would be to your right and West would be to your left.

questions.question_text: Sana is facing North. Her school is to her right. In which direction is her school?
questions.explanation_correct: If Sana is facing North and her school is to her right, the school is in the East direction. When facing North: right is East, left is West, and behind is South.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When you face North, your right hand points East and your left hand points West. Since Sana's school is to her right and she is facing North, her school is in the East.

questions.question_text: Every morning, Ravi sees the sun from his bedroom window. His bedroom window faces _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Since Ravi sees the sunrise from his bedroom window every morning, his window must face East. The sun always rises in the East.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun rises in the East every morning. If Ravi can see the sun rising from his bedroom window, then his window must face East. Windows facing West would show the sunset, not the sunrise.

questions.question_text: North and South are _____ directions.
questions.explanation_correct: North and South are opposite directions. If you go North, you are going away from the South. Similarly, East and West are also opposite directions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: North and South are not the same or side by side. They are opposite directions — if you face North, South is directly behind you. The other pair of opposite directions is East and West.

questions.question_text: If you face North, East is to your right and West is to your left. Which direction is opposite to East?
questions.explanation_correct: West is opposite to East. Just as North and South are opposite directions, East and West are also opposite directions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: North is not opposite to East, and South is not opposite to East. The direction opposite to East is West. Remember: North-South are opposite, and East-West are opposite.

questions.question_text: What is a map?

options.text: A drawing that shows places from above

questions.explanation_correct: A map is a drawing that shows places from above, like looking down from a bird's eye view. It shows roads, buildings, rivers, and other important places using symbols.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A map is not a photograph, painting, or story. It is a special drawing that shows places from above, as if you are a bird looking down. Maps use symbols to represent roads, buildings, parks, and rivers.

questions.question_text: Maps show places as if seen from _____.

options.text: Above, like a bird looking down

questions.explanation_correct: Maps show places as if seen from above, like a bird flying in the sky and looking down. This view from above is called a bird's eye view.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Maps do not show places from the ground level or from under the ground. They show places from above, as if you were a bird flying high in the sky and looking down. This is why it is called a bird's eye view.

questions.question_text: What do maps use to show different places like roads, buildings, and rivers?
questions.explanation_correct: Maps use symbols and pictures to show different things. For example, blue lines for rivers, small squares for buildings, and thick lines for roads.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Maps cannot use real objects — they are drawn on paper. They use symbols and small pictures to represent roads, rivers, buildings, parks, and other places. Each symbol has a meaning.

questions.question_text: Neha's teacher asks her to draw a map of her classroom from above. How should she show the desks?

options.text: Draw desks from the side, like she sees them normally
Draw small rectangles as seen from above

questions.explanation_correct: On a map, everything is drawn as seen from above. So desks would look like small rectangles when seen from the top. This is the bird's eye view used in maps.
questions.explanation_incorrect: In a map, we draw things as they look from above. A desk seen from the top would look like a rectangle. We do not draw the side view or just write words. Maps show the top view of objects.

questions.question_text: On a map, a blue wavy line is drawn. What could it represent?
questions.explanation_correct: On a map, a blue wavy line usually represents a river. Blue is used for water on maps because water looks blue. Rivers are drawn as wavy lines because rivers curve and flow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Roads are usually shown as straight or curved thick lines, buildings as squares or rectangles, and mountains as triangles or brown areas. A blue wavy line on a map represents a river because blue is used for water.

questions.question_text: Why are maps useful?

options.text: They help us find places and see where things are

questions.explanation_correct: Maps are useful because they help us find places and see where things are. If you want to know how to get from your house to the market, a map can show you the way.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Maps do not help with cooking, watering plants, or reading books. Maps are special drawings that help us find places, plan routes, and understand where different things like roads, buildings, and rivers are located.

questions.question_text: Which of these can we find using a map?
questions.explanation_correct: We can find the location of a hospital using a map. Maps show where places like hospitals, schools, parks, and markets are located. They help us find our way to these places.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Maps show locations and directions, not tastes, colours, or sounds. We use a map to find where a hospital, school, park, or market is located and how to get there.

questions.question_text: What is a landmark?

options.text: A well-known place that helps us find our way

questions.explanation_correct: A landmark is a well-known place that helps us find our way. Examples include a school, hospital, temple, mosque, church, post office, railway station, or market.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A landmark is not a piece of land, a mark on a wall, or an animal. It is a well-known place like a hospital, school, temple, or big building that people can easily recognise and use to give or find directions.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a landmark?

options.text: A small stone on the road

questions.explanation_correct: A hospital is a landmark because it is a well-known place that many people recognise. We can use landmarks like hospitals, schools, and temples to give directions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A stone, leaf, or cloud cannot be used as landmarks because they are small, move, or change. A hospital is a landmark because it is a well-known, fixed building that everyone can recognise.

questions.question_text: Aarav's mother tells him: 'Turn left at the big red post office.' What is the post office in this direction?
questions.explanation_correct: The post office is being used as a landmark. A landmark is a well-known place that helps people find their way. Aarav's mother is using the post office to help him know where to turn.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The post office is not a direction, map, or symbol. It is being used as a landmark — a well-known place that helps Aarav know where to turn left. Landmarks make it easier to give and follow directions.

questions.question_text: Meera wants to tell her friend how to reach her house. Which of these would be most helpful?

options.text: Turn right after the park, then go straight past the temple
I live in a big house

questions.explanation_correct: Using landmarks like the park and temple along with directions like 'turn right' and 'go straight' is the best way to guide someone. This gives clear directions using well-known places.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Saying a house is nice, has a garden, or is big does not help someone find it. Using landmarks (park, temple) and directions (turn right, go straight) is the correct way to give clear directions.

questions.question_text: Which of the following can be used as a landmark to give directions?
questions.explanation_correct: A railway station can be used as a landmark because it is a well-known, fixed place. A bus, bird, or car cannot be landmarks because they move around and are not in one fixed place.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Landmarks must be fixed in one place so people can always find them. A bus, bird, and car all move around. A railway station is always in the same place, so it is a good landmark.

questions.question_text: What is the first thing you should look for on a map?
questions.explanation_correct: The first thing to look for on a map is the direction arrows, especially the arrow showing North. This helps you understand which way is up and which way is down, left, and right on the map.
questions.explanation_incorrect: While colours and other details are important, the first thing to look for on a map is the direction arrow showing where North is. Once you know where North is, you can figure out all other directions.

questions.question_text: On most maps, North is usually shown at the _____.
questions.explanation_correct: On most maps, North is shown at the top. This means South is at the bottom, East is on the right, and West is on the left.
questions.explanation_incorrect: By convention, North is usually shown at the top of a map. Once you know that, South is at the bottom, East is to the right, and West is to the left. This is the standard way maps are drawn.

questions.question_text: On a map, the park is shown to the right of the school. If North is at the top of the map, the park is in which direction from the school?
questions.explanation_correct: If North is at the top of the map, then right is East. Since the park is to the right of the school, the park is to the East of the school.
questions.explanation_incorrect: On a map where North is at the top: right = East, left = West, top = North, bottom = South. The park is to the right of the school, so it is in the East direction.

questions.question_text: Riya is drawing a map of her neighbourhood. She wants to show a river. What should she use?
questions.explanation_correct: Riya should use a blue wavy line to show a river on her map. Blue represents water, and rivers are drawn as wavy lines because they curve and flow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rivers are shown as blue wavy lines on maps. Blue is the colour used for water, and wavy lines show that the river curves and flows. Red lines, green circles, and brown triangles represent other things.

questions.question_text: On a map, if North is at the top, where is West?
questions.explanation_correct: On a map where North is at the top, West is on the left side. East is on the right, and South is at the bottom.
questions.explanation_incorrect: On a standard map: North = top, South = bottom, East = right, West = left. So West is on the left side of the map when North is at the top.

questions.question_text: Vikram is facing East. He turns all the way to his left. Now he is facing _____.
questions.explanation_correct: If Vikram is facing East and turns left, he will face North. When facing East: left is North, right is South, and behind is West.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When Vikram faces East and turns left (a quarter turn), he faces North. If he turned right, he would face South. If he turned completely around, he would face West. Turning left from East leads to North.

questions.question_text: Isha is standing in a garden. The sun is setting on her left. Which direction is she facing?
questions.explanation_correct: The sun sets in the West. If the sunset (West) is on Isha's left side, she must be facing North. When facing North: left is West and right is East. Since the setting sun (West) is on her left, she is facing North.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun sets in the West. When facing North, your left hand points to the West and your right hand points to the East. Since the setting sun (West) is on Isha's left side, she must be facing North, not South, East, or West.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a good landmark?
questions.explanation_correct: A stray dog is NOT a good landmark because it moves around. A landmark should be a fixed, well-known place that everyone can find. Schools, temples, and post offices stay in one place.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A school, temple, and post office are all good landmarks because they are fixed in one place and well-known. A stray dog keeps moving around, so it cannot be used as a landmark.

questions.question_text: Kunal is looking at a map of his area. He sees a small green area with tree symbols. What could this be?
questions.explanation_correct: A green area with tree symbols on a map usually represents a park or garden. Green is used for natural areas with plants and trees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rivers are shown in blue, roads as thick lines, and hospitals with special symbols. A green area with tree symbols on a map most likely represents a park, garden, or forest.

questions.question_text: Which skill is most important when reading a map?
questions.explanation_correct: Understanding symbols and directions is the most important skill when reading a map. You need to know what the symbols mean and which way is North, South, East, and West.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Singing, running, and painting are not needed for reading maps. The most important skill is understanding what the map symbols mean and knowing the four directions so you can find places correctly.

questions.question_text: Which of these helps us find the direction East?

options.text: Looking at where the sun sets
Looking at where the sun rises
Looking at the stars at night

questions.explanation_correct: We can find East by looking at where the sun rises. The sun always rises in the East. Once we know East, we can figure out all other directions too.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun sets in the West, not the East. Stars and the moon are not easy ways for children to find directions. The easiest way to find East is to see where the sun rises in the morning.

questions.question_text: Why are landmarks important when giving directions?

options.text: They help people identify and find the right place easily

questions.explanation_correct: Landmarks help people identify and find places easily. When someone says 'Turn left at the hospital', everyone knows which hospital they mean, making it easy to follow directions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Landmarks are not just for decoration or tourists. They are important because they are well-known places that help people navigate and find their way. Using landmarks makes giving and following directions much easier.

questions.question_text: The sun rises in the West.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. The sun rises in the East, not the West. The sun sets in the West. Remember: East = sunrise, West = sunset.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun does NOT rise in the West. It rises in the East every morning and sets in the West every evening. The correct statement would be 'The sun rises in the East.'

questions.question_text: A map shows places from above, like a bird looking down.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. A map shows places as they would look from above, like a bird flying in the sky and looking down. This is called a bird's eye view.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Maps do show places from above. Imagine you are a bird flying high in the sky and looking down — that is how a map shows things. This view from above is called a bird's eye view.

questions.question_text: There are four main directions: North, South, East, and West.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. The four main directions are North, South, East, and West. They help us find places and know which way to go.
questions.explanation_incorrect: There are indeed four main directions: North, South, East, and West. These are the basic directions that help us navigate and find places. This statement is true.

questions.question_text: A moving bus can be used as a good landmark.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. A moving bus cannot be a good landmark because it keeps changing its position. A landmark should be a fixed place that stays in one spot, like a school, hospital, or temple.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bus moves around the city and is never in one fixed place. A good landmark must be something permanent and fixed, like a building, temple, or railway station. So a moving bus is NOT a good landmark.

questions.question_text: On most maps, North is shown at the top.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. On most maps, North is shown at the top. This means South is at the bottom, East is on the right, and West is on the left.
questions.explanation_incorrect: By convention, most maps are drawn with North at the top. When North is at the top, South is at the bottom, East is on the right, and West is on the left. This statement is true.

questions.question_text: The sun rises in the _____ and sets in the West.
questions.explanation_correct: The sun rises in the East and sets in the West. This is one of the easiest ways to find directions — just look at where the sun comes up in the morning.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is East. Every morning, the sun rises in the East direction. In the evening, it sets in the West direction. This never changes.

questions.question_text: The four main directions are North, South, _____, and West.
questions.explanation_correct: The four main directions are North, South, East, and West. Together, they help us find our way and locate places.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is East. The four main directions are North, South, East, and West. Remember them by going clockwise: North, East, South, West.

questions.question_text: A map shows places from above. This view is called a bird's _____ view.
questions.explanation_correct: This view is called a bird's eye view because it shows things as if a bird were flying above and looking down. Maps are drawn from this top-down perspective.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is eye. A bird's eye view means looking at things from above, just like a bird sees the ground when it flies. Maps use this view to show places.

questions.question_text: A well-known place that helps us find our way is called a _____.
questions.explanation_correct: A well-known place that helps us find our way is called a landmark. Schools, hospitals, temples, and post offices are all examples of landmarks.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is landmark. A landmark is a well-known, fixed place that helps people give and follow directions. Examples include schools, hospitals, temples, and railway stations.

questions.question_text: If you face North, _____ is behind you.
questions.explanation_correct: If you face North, South is behind you. North and South are opposite directions, just like East and West are opposite directions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is South. North and South are opposite directions. When you face North, South is always directly behind you. Similarly, when you face East, West is behind you.

questions.question_text: Which colour is usually used to show water (rivers, lakes) on maps?
questions.explanation_correct: Blue is usually used to show water on maps. Rivers, lakes, oceans, and ponds are all shown in blue because water appears blue.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Red, green, and yellow are used for other things on maps. Blue is the colour used to show water like rivers, lakes, and oceans. This is because water looks blue in nature.

questions.question_text: Tanya is drawing a map. She puts her house in the centre. The school is to the north of her house. Where should she draw the school on her map?

options.text: To the left of her house
To the right of her house

questions.explanation_correct: Since North is shown at the top of a map, and the school is to the north of Tanya's house, she should draw the school above her house on the map.
questions.explanation_incorrect: On a map, North is at the top. Since the school is to the north of Tanya's house, it should be drawn above her house on the map. Below would be South, left would be West, and right would be East.

questions.question_text: Arun tells his friend: 'Go straight from the bus stop, turn right at the big temple, and my house is next to the bakery.' How many landmarks did Arun use?
questions.explanation_correct: Arun used three landmarks: the bus stop, the temple, and the bakery. Each one helps his friend find the right path to his house.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Count the well-known places Arun mentioned: (1) bus stop, (2) big temple, and (3) bakery. That is three landmarks he used to give directions to his house.

questions.question_text: If you face South, which direction is to your right?
questions.explanation_correct: If you face South, West is to your right. When facing South: left is East, right is West, and behind you is North. This is the opposite of facing North.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When facing South, the directions flip compared to facing North. Your right hand points West and your left hand points East. North is behind you. So West is to your right when facing South.

questions.question_text: Maps use symbols to show roads, buildings, and rivers.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Maps use symbols like lines for roads, rectangles for buildings, and blue wavy lines for rivers. Symbols make it easy to show many things on a small piece of paper.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Maps do use symbols to represent different things. Roads are shown as lines, buildings as small shapes, rivers as blue wavy lines, and parks as green areas. This statement is true.

questions.question_text: On a map, North is at the top. If a hospital is shown at the bottom-right corner, it is in which direction?
questions.explanation_correct: Bottom is South and right is East. So the bottom-right corner is South-East. The hospital is in the South-East direction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: On a map with North at top: bottom = South, right = East. So the bottom-right corner combines South and East to give South-East. The hospital is in the South-East direction.

questions.question_text: A _____, temple, or hospital can be used as landmarks to give directions.
questions.explanation_correct: A school, temple, or hospital can all be used as landmarks. They are well-known, fixed places that people can easily recognise when following directions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is school (or similar well-known place). Schools, temples, hospitals, post offices, and railway stations are all good landmarks because they are well-known and stay in one fixed place.

questions.question_text: Priya is facing West. She turns to her right. Now she is facing _____.
questions.explanation_correct: If Priya is facing West and turns right, she faces North. When facing West: right is North, left is South, and behind is East.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When Priya faces West and turns right (a quarter turn), she faces North. If she turned left from West, she would face South. Turning right from West leads to North.
